page.title: 01Life in the Penn Countryside
page.content: This is an account of the economic and social life styles of the inhabitants of the Chepping Parishes of Coleshill, Penn and the surrounding villages. Many commuters live in this area,thus there is a high demand for{housing} and property is very expensive.Much of the{farmland}is managed on behalf of the owners, many of whom live elsewhere.Farmland is intensively worked for both dairying and beef production.Cottage{industries}are evident on a small scale.There is no heavy <or light> industry in this area. The area attracts large numbers of {tourists}mainly due to its picturesque scenery and its historical fame, notably the Pilgrim Father,William Penn.
